Wisdom: جُحُودُ الْإِحْسَانِ يَحْدُو عَلَى قُبْحِ الِامْتِنَانِ
enWisdom: Denying a favour instigates the ugliness of obligation
Denying the benevolence [of others] leads to deprivation
The good turn of wealth ceases with its cessation
The habit of the inexperienced [and ignorant] ones is to cut off the elements of favour

Wisdom: عَجِبْتُ لِمَنْ يَرْجُو فَضْلَ مَنْ فَوْقَهُ كَيْفَ يَحْرِمُ مَنْ دُونَهُ
enWisdom: I wonder at the person who hopes for favour from the one who is above him, how can he deprive the one who is below him [of his own favour]?

Wisdom: مَنْ قَطَعَ مَعْهُودَ إِحْسَانِهِ قَطَعَ اللَّهُ مَوْجُودَ إِمْكَانِهِ
enWisdom: One who cuts off his usual favours, Allah will cut off his present capabilities
One who does not bestow favours will not achieve nobility
One who does not give generously does not gain authority
One who conceals the favour [that has been done to him] is punished with deprivation
One who withholds favours is stripped of [his] ability

Wisdom: مَنْ كَافَأَ الْإِحْسَانَ بِالْإِسَاءَةِ فَقَدْ بَرِئَ مِنَ الْمُرُوَّةِ
enWisdom: The most severely punished of all people is one who recompenses good with evil

Wisdom: لَا تَمْنَعَنَّ الْمَعْرُوفَ وَإِنْ لَمْ تَجِدْ عَرُوفاً
enWisdom: Never hold back an act of benevolence, even if you do not find one who understands its value

Wisdom: لَا تَمْتَنِعَنَّ [لا تملن‏] مِنْ فِعْلِ الْمَعْرُوفِ وَالْإِحْسَانِ فَتُسْلَبَ الْإِمْكَانَ
enWisdom: Never hold back from doing good turns and favours thereby being stripped of [your] ability

Wisdom: لَا يُزَهِّدَنَّكَ فِي اصْطِنَاعِ الْمَعْرُوفِ قِلَّةُ مَنْ يَشْكُرُهُ فَقَدْ يَشْكُرُكَ عَلَيْهِ مَنْ لَا يَنْتَفِعُ بِشَيْ‏ءٍ مِنْهُ وَقَدْ يُدْرَكُ مِنْ شُكْرِ الشَّاكِرِ أَكْثَرُ مِمَّا أَضَاعَ الْكَافِرُ
enWisdom: Never let the paucity of those who show gratitude for your benevolence deter you from it, for you have been thanked by the One who does not benefit from any of it; and more may be gained from the gratitude of the thankful than what is neglected by the ingrate
